title: Interpolate monthly data to weekly data
text: vignette demonstrates approach interpolate weekly data 8-week data vaccine effectiveness using following approach: Generate many (e.g 1000) 8-week VE samples random normal distribution mean standard deviation 8-week VE log HR scale Fit model 1000 8-week VE samples store fitted values well standard deviation residuals Add noise fitted values using standard deviation residuals get weekly VE samples

title: Interpolate monthly data to weekly data
text: use toy dataset provided package, containing 8-weeks estimates vaccine effectiveness (VE) 12 months.

title: Interpolate monthly data to weekly data
code: seed_to_use <- 666

title: Interpolate monthly data to weekly data
code: # Create exponential model using the R6 class exponential_model <- DecayModel$new(     name = "exponential",     decay_function = exponential_decay(),     param_config = list(         start = c(VE0 = 0.7, decay_rate = 0.1),         lower = c(0.01, 0.001),         upper = c(0.99, 1.0),         names = c("VE0", "decay_rate")     ) )  exponential_result <- exponential_model$fit_to_determine_bic(     estimate = sample_8_weeks_data$estimate,     ci_low = sample_8_weeks_data$CIlow,     ci_up = sample_8_weeks_data$CIhigh,     periods_starts = sample_8_weeks_data$date_min,     periods_ends = sample_8_weeks_data$date_max,     seed = seed_to_use ) #> Exponential Model Results: #> Coefficients: VE0 = 0.7309, decay_rate = 0.0363 #> BIC: -13.85595

title: Interpolate monthly data to weekly data
code: # Create logistic model using the R6 class logistic_model <- DecayModel$new(     name = "logistic",     decay_function = logistic_decay(),     param_config = list(         start = c(VE0 = 0.7, decay_rate = 0.1, constant = 0.5),         lower = c(0.01, 0.001, 0.01),         upper = c(0.99, 1.0, 2.0),         names = c("VE0", "decay_rate", "constant")     ) )  logistic_result <- logistic_model$fit_to_determine_bic(     estimate = sample_8_weeks_data$estimate,     ci_low = sample_8_weeks_data$CIlow,     ci_up = sample_8_weeks_data$CIhigh,     periods_starts = sample_8_weeks_data$date_min,     periods_ends = sample_8_weeks_data$date_max,     seed = seed_to_use ) #> Logistic Model Results: #> Coefficients: VE0 = 0.6583, decay_rate = 0.1007, constant = 0.078 #> BIC: -12.469

title: Interpolate monthly data to weekly data
code: # Plot exponential model p1 <- exponential_model$plot_optimal(     estimate = sample_8_weeks_data$estimate,     ci_low = sample_8_weeks_data$CIlow,     ci_up = sample_8_weeks_data$CIhigh,     periods_starts = sample_8_weeks_data$date_min,     periods_ends = sample_8_weeks_data$date_max,     title = "Exponential Decay Model (3-Step)",     color = "red",     age_group = "65-79",     site = "Somewhere",     season = "2023-2024",     outcome = "Some outcome" )  # Plot logistic model p2 <- logistic_model$plot_optimal(     estimate = sample_8_weeks_data$estimate,     ci_low = sample_8_weeks_data$CIlow,     ci_up = sample_8_weeks_data$CIhigh,     periods_starts = sample_8_weeks_data$date_min,     periods_ends = sample_8_weeks_data$date_max,     title = "Logistic Decay Model (3-Step)",     color = "blue",     age_group = "65-79",     site = "Somewhere",     season = "2023-2024",     outcome = "Some outcome" ) grid.arrange(p1, p2, ncol = 2)

title: Interpolate monthly data to weekly data
code:
comparison_result <- compare_decay_models(     model_names = c("exponential", "logistic"),     estimate = sample_8_weeks_data$estimate,     ci_low = sample_8_weeks_data$CIlow,     ci_up = sample_8_weeks_data$CIhigh,     periods_starts = sample_8_weeks_data$date_min,     periods_ends = sample_8_weeks_data$date_max,     seed = seed_to_use )  # View comparison results cat("Model Comparison Summary:
") #> Model Comparison Summary: print(comparison_result$summary) #>         model       aic       bic #> 1 exponential -15.31067 -13.85595 #> 2    logistic -14.40862 -12.46900  # Find best model based on BIC best_model_bic <- get_best_model(comparison_result, criterion = "bic") cat("
Best model based on BIC:", best_model_bic$model_name, "
") #>  #> Best model based on BIC: exponential cat("Best BIC:", best_model_bic$criterion, "
") #> Best BIC: -13.85595

title: Interpolate monthly data to weekly data
code: # Create comparison plot using BIC criterion comparison_plot <- plot_model_comparison(     comparison_result = comparison_result,     estimate = sample_8_weeks_data$estimate,     ci_low = sample_8_weeks_data$CIlow,     ci_up = sample_8_weeks_data$CIhigh,     periods_starts = sample_8_weeks_data$date_min,     periods_ends = sample_8_weeks_data$date_max,     criterion = "bic",     age_group = "65-79",     site = "Somewhere",     season = "2023-2024",     outcome = "Some outcome" )  print(comparison_plot)

code: # Plot VE with uncertainty bands uncertainty_plot <- best_model$model$plot_VE_with_uncertainty(     periods_starts = sample_8_weeks_data$date_min,     periods_ends = sample_8_weeks_data$date_max )  print(uncertainty_plot)

title: Interpolate monthly data to weekly data
code: ve_uncertainty_plot_plus_raw_data <- best_model$model$plot_VE_with_uncertainty_plus_raw_data(     estimate = sample_8_weeks_data$estimate,     ci_low = sample_8_weeks_data$CIlow,     ci_up = sample_8_weeks_data$CIhigh,     periods_starts = sample_8_weeks_data$date_min,     periods_ends = sample_8_weeks_data$date_max )  print(ve_uncertainty_plot_plus_raw_data)

title: VE interpolation package
text: package allows interpolate weekly data 8-week data vaccine effectiveness (VE) data. See dedicated vignette details: Interpolate Monthly Data Weekly Data

title: DecayModel class — DecayModel
text: name Model name decay_function decay function param_config Parameter configuration optimization_results Results last optimization nlrob_samples List nlrob samples ve_summary Summary VE samples

title: DecayModel class — DecayModel
text: DecayModel$new() DecayModel$evaluate() DecayModel$create_nls_formula() DecayModel$fit_to_determine_bic() DecayModel$generate_VE_based_on_resampling() DecayModel$generate_VE_summary() DecayModel$plot_VE_with_uncertainty() DecayModel$plot_VE_with_uncertainty_plus_raw_data() DecayModel$plot_bootstrap_samples() DecayModel$get_optimal_params() DecayModel$get_aic() DecayModel$get_bic() DecayModel$predict_optimal() DecayModel$predict() DecayModel$plot_optimal() DecayModel$plot() DecayModel$print() DecayModel$build_prediction_dataset() DecayModel$clone()

code: DecayModel$fit_to_determine_bic(   estimate,   ci_low,   ci_up,   periods_starts,   periods_ends,   seed = 123,   maxiteritations = 50,   type_of_fit = "midpoint" )

title: DecayModel class — DecayModel
text: estimate Log estimates (HR scale) ci_low Lower confidence interval bounds (HR scale) ci_up Upper confidence interval bounds (HR scale) periods_starts Vector periods starts periods_ends Vector periods ends seed Seed reproducibility (default 123) maxiteritations Maximum number iterations nls (default 500) type_of_fit Type fit (default "midpoint")

text: estimate Log estimates (HR scale) ci_low Lower confidence interval bounds (HR scale) ci_up Upper confidence interval bounds (HR scale) periods_starts Vector periods starts periods_ends Vector periods ends n_weekly_ve_to_generate Number weekly VE generate (default 1000) type_of_fit Type fit (default "midpoint") seed Seed reproducibility (default 123)

title: Build time objects for interpolation — build_time_objects
Compare multiple decay models — compare_decay_models
text: Compare multiple decay models Plot model comparison Get best model based lowest AIC Get best model name Get best model instance

title: Compare multiple decay models — compare_decay_models
code: compare_decay_models(   model_names = c("exponential", "logistic", "logistic_simple"),   estimate,   ci_low,   ci_up,   periods_starts,   periods_ends,   decay_funs = list(exponential = exponential_decay(), logistic = logistic_decay(),     logistic_simple = logistic_simple_decay()),   param_configs = list(exponential = list(start = c(VE0 = 0.7, decay_rate = 0.1), lower =     c(0.01, 0.001), upper = c(0.99, 1), names = c("VE0", "decay_rate")), logistic =     list(start = c(VE0 = 0.7, decay_rate = 0.1, constant = 0.5), lower = c(0.01, 0.001,     0.01), upper = c(0.99, 1, 2), names = c("VE0", "decay_rate", "constant")),     logistic_simple = list(start = c(VE0 = 0.7, decay_rate = 0.1), lower = c(0.01,     0.001), upper = c(0.99, 1), names = c("VE0", "decay_rate"))),   seed = 123,   type_of_fit = "midpoint" )  plot_model_comparison(   comparison_result,   estimate,   ci_low,   ci_up,   periods_starts,   periods_ends,   colors = c("red", "blue", "green", "purple", "orange"),   criterion = "bic",   age_group,   site,   season,   outcome )  get_best_model(comparison_result, criterion = "aic")  get_best_model_name(comparison_result, criterion = "aic")  get_best_model_instance(comparison_result, criterion = "aic")

title: Compare multiple decay models — compare_decay_models
text: model_names Vector model names use (default c("exponential", "logistic")) estimate Vector estimates (HR scale) ci_low Vector lower confidence interval bounds (HR scale) ci_up Vector upper confidence interval bounds (HR scale) periods_starts Vector periods starts periods_ends Vector periods ends decay_funs List decay functions use (default list(exponential = exponential_decay(), logistic = logistic_decay(), logistic_simple = logistic_simple_decay())) param_configs List parameter configurations use (default list(exponential = list(start = c(VE0 = 0.7, decay_rate = 0.1), lower = c(0.01, 0.001), upper = c(0.99, 1.0), names = c("VE0", "decay_rate")), logistic = list(start = c(VE0 = 0.7, decay_rate = 0.1, constant = 0.5), lower = c(0.01, 0.001, 0.01), upper = c(0.99, 1.0, 2.0), names = c("VE0", "decay_rate", "constant")), logistic_simple = list(start = c(VE0 = 0.7, decay_rate = 0.1), lower = c(0.01, 0.001), upper = c(0.99, 1.0), names = c("VE0", "decay_rate")))) seed Seed use reproducibility (default 123) type_of_fit Type fit (default "midpoint") comparison_result List containing models, results, comparison, summary colors Vector colors use models (default c("red", "blue", "green", "purple", "orange")) criterion Criterion use best model selection (default "aic") age_group Age group site Site season Season outcome Outcome

title: Compare multiple decay models — compare_decay_models
text: List containing models, results, comparison, summary ggplot object List containing best model name, instance, AIC, results Best model name Best model instance
